description: Borrowed from Latin convolvere, present active infinitive of convolvō (“roll together”), from con- (“together”) + volvō (“roll”); see voluble, volute, and compare involve, evolve, revolve.

verbs.description: convolve (third-person singular simple present convolves, present participle convolving, simple past and past participle convolved)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To roll together, or one part on another
(mathematics) To form the convolution of something with something else
